message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.LG

The paper deals with natural language processing and computational sociolinguistics to detect social engineering attacks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also deals with cybersecurity and risk assessment, which makes cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) another likely category. The use of structural clues such as links and their proximity to identified asks suggests the category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also uses machine learning techniques, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper deals with the impact of linguistic and structural knowledge, which could fall under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
